entry.value:
{"@class":"org.knime.js.core.JSONDataTable","id":"preview","filtered":false,"rows":[{"data":["Charle128","Italian With Pizzazz","
I'm a particular eater. I tried because of the great reviews and was not disappointed. The food literally melted in my mouth and I may have said wow out loud.
The energy is good & the Italian waiters were too. They all wore a inspiring tee and were cheery and helpful. It's very popular and was quite loud with lots...

More ",4.0,9.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row0"},{"data":["Siempreotravez","Who Doesn't like Italian?","
If you don't like Italian food there's something wrong with you. You should skip this review and restaurant and go elsewhere. Now for the rest of us, this is a great place. Hey it's right in the center of north beach activity. It is in the first Bank of America building at Columbus and Broadway. Don't let the banking history...

More ",5.0,27.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row1"},{"data":["Meysam M","Great Italian Food Served by Italian People","
The first sign that you're going to have authentic Italian food is that the restaurant is run by happy Italian people!
",5.0,17.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row2"},{"data":["atima","Fantastic Italian","
Found this place when looking for a new Italian spot in North Beach. At a busy intersection of Broadway and Columbus, right across the street from the landmark City Lights Bookstore.
The service and food here were both fantastic. Very reasonable prices and good portions. This will be my new go-to Italian restaurant in SF. Highly recommended.
",4.0,168.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row3"},{"data":["Maria B","Outstanding Italian!","
My family and I had such a great experience here......outstanding service, really fun and attentive (not to mention adorable!) waiters, fabulous music, and most importantly outstanding Italian food. The seafood was delicious, and the panna cotte was to die for!! If you come to San Fran, make sure you come here!
",5.0,1.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row4"},{"data":["73_ptr","Super good thin crust pizza","
We went for a family dinner on a Sunday night. We called ahead, and we're glad we did as the place was packed. I had originally decided to go for a secondi, but upon seeing the pizzas on offer, I quickly changed my mind. We ordered a margherita for the kids (half a pizza was enough for 6 and 8...

More ",4.0,41.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row5"},{"data":["Juan Pablo E","Great pasta, pizza and service!","
The place to go for italian food. Waiters are lots of fun, italian and really good at their job. The restaurant is beautiful and the food is great.
Try the salmon pasta!
",5.0,73.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row6"},{"data":["ElisaFerroni","Great Italian dinner","
I am Italian and I was impressed to find a real Italian restaurant in SF! Very good food, cooked at the Italian way, Italian owner and waiters! It was a nice lovely dinner in our honeymoon!! Finally we ate a real pizza!
",4.0,13.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row7"},{"data":["Erin G","Fantastic experience, delicious meal!!","
Not only is it located in a great location, the service is fantastic, the atmosphere is unique and exciting and the food is delicious!! Dessert is even better!! Will return!
",4.0,3.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row8"},{"data":["VBCIreland","What a delight!!","
Sincerely...what a delight to walk into this restaurant! We have four children - three of whom cannot eat gluten, including myself. The staff could not have been more helpful, they went through all of our options, that included not having to take something from the kids menu. Its so refreshing to be in a restaurant, that are so helpful when...

More ",5.0,21.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row9"},{"data":["Familiearnhem","Authentic italian food, worth waiting for.","
Friendly staff, delicious pizza, good atmosphere. We have had a wonderfull diner, restaurant is easy to find.
",5.0,1.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row10"},{"data":["Amee L","True Italian","
Handmade Pasta, Italian-accented staff, delicious salads, entrees and desserts-and amazing attention from all staff on our anniversary.
",5.0,4.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row11"},{"data":["GluttonChops","Great pizza and attentive service","
I've been looking for a great thin crust pizza and finally found it here. Just like the pizza that I used to get in Rome. The buffalo mozzarella appetizer was also very tasty.
The fish wasn't quite so good with a thick, goopy tomato sauce. But, overall it wasn't bad.
The service was very, very friendly, almost to the point...

More ",4.0,50.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row12"},{"data":["Newpaige","Authentic Italian","
The owner and staff here are from Italy. It doesn't get more authentic!!! The food was amazing and the atmosphere was very cozy!!! Strongly recommend this place!
",5.0,4.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row13"},{"data":["Catherine I","Great authentic Italian food","
Food is outstanding here! Authentic Italian fare. Staff was friendly and knowledgable. The pasta was definitely homemade and the sauces were light, like you actually find in Italy, not heavy like typical American style Italian food.
",5.0,2.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row14"},{"data":["Anders G","Very good food and almost over friendly staff","
We came in very early evening when the restaurant was almost empty as we wanted a quick snack after 20+ hours of travel. Everyone in the staff asked where we came from (Sweden) and offered various greetings in Swedish which they had picked up (well!). We had the pizza salsiccia and scallops/crab meat linguini and both dishes were excellent. As...

More ",5.0,27.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row15"},{"data":["Ellebasi86","Porcini Porcini!","
We shared a porcini pizza the other night and I have been salivating ever since at the thought of it. The pizza crust was thin and crunchy, the porcini fresh and the amount of cheese perfect. The wait staff were all very friendly but didn't disrupt us too often. Seriously hot guy behind the bar... those blue eyes!! Phew. Anyway,...

More ",5.0,11.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row16"},{"data":["Geno2013","This is an experience you will not forget !","
If you have ever been to Italy, you will think you returned. The best Italian food in San Francisco, the best service, the atmosphere is like you are in Milan, Italy. Every one, even the owner greets you.
This restorante is busy, so make a reservation. This is excellent plus!
",5.0,12.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row17"},{"data":["Christina B","Amazing food & service!!!","
There are a lot of Italian restaurants in the area and it can be overwhelming to choose, but you have to go here at least once!!!! We saw the amazing reviews and decided to give it a try. Upon arrival we received the warmest Italian greeting. We were seated immediately and the hospitality of the staff was spectacular. I've worked...

More ",5.0,26.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row18"},{"data":["Alibaba311","Can't go wrong here","
Went here with a party of 14 after seeing good reviews on tripadvisor and yelp. It certainly stood up to the reviews. Everyone was happy with there dish - even the three in from italy! We are all particularly picky when it comes to italian food. I tried the fried calamari and zucchini appetizer, seared scallops with porcini mushrooms, squid...

More ",4.0,3.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row19"},{"data":["PJAnkerman","It's all about the atmosphere! (But the food is great too!)","
We visited San Francisco with our four teenage grandchildren and Googled Italian restaurants for teens and E Tutto Qua popped up so we decided to try it. We were not disappointed! Although the food was good, it was the host and wait staff that made our experience at this wonderful restaurant unforgettable! They entertained the entire dining room with high-energy...

More ",5.0,5.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row20"},{"data":["FLPantherDog","Amazing Food Fun Staff","
Took a chance without reservations. Waited over an hour but only because of a issue with the credit card machines so tables didn't clear fast. The greeter made it fun though and kept us informed. Once we were seated it was terrific. All of the staff were Italian and really made the experience eating here fun.
We began with a...

More ",5.0,29.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row21"},{"data":["gaius_11","fun Italian meal in North Beach","
We had a party of 6 one night during Dine About Town. Everything was very good. The waiters were singing along to the Italian music on the audio system (amusing). The only odd part of the evening was their insistence that everyone or no one choose the prix fixe Dine About Town menu. Other places do not do that. I...

More ",4.0,9.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row22"},{"data":["YepBeenThere","Fantastic find, great food, excellent service and an INCREDIBLE value.","
This was a great find! Absolutely ideal place for authentic Italian food at reasonable prices. You can't go wrong if you want casual dining, excellent service with great recommendations. We will be back!
",5.0,201.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row23"},{"data":["Cugno","As authentic as it gets","
Our 12 yo said let's eat there so we did.
This randomly selected restaurant by my 12 yo was a sensation. It is authentic Italian food not modified for the American palate (read sweet).
The mixed entree really showed off the chefs range of skills.. Every piece was perfectly prepared, cooked and presented. The pasta was freshly made all soft...

More ",5.0,66.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row24"},{"data":["Pam M","Friendly, fun, flavorful & fresh!!","
What a find! In North Beach, good Italian restaurants abound, but what makes E Tutto Qua a stand-out is the staff! Super-personable (and handsome), they elevate the dining experience for all! Our entrees (spinach ravioli & spaghetti neri) were absolutely delish and the wine list (by the glass) was extensive. Can't wait for another opportunity to dine here!
",5.0,83.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row25"},{"data":["la2nj","Delicious Italian food if you don't mind the noise","
The food at E Tutto Qua was really, really good. My friend and I dined here for the 2-week special Dine About Town prix fixed $36.95 dinner featuring 3 courses. Unlike some other places, the portions here were full sized. The place seemed to have more a local feel with many younger adults than one that is where tourists typically...

More ",4.0,194.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row26"},{"data":["SheilaBea","Great place","
Had a lovely meal here last night , the service was superb, the food amazing and the atmosphere fabulous
",5.0,15.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row27"},{"data":["Angelina M","Dinner","
I came to visit my sister and her husband, they recommended this spot. We walked in and were instantly greeted with smiling faces. The wait staff are amazing and clearly love what they do. We ordered lamb chops, swordfish, pasta with mussels, and lamb pasta. All three dishes were worth every penny, we couldn't have been happier with the food,...

More ",5.0,1.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row28"},{"data":["Missy W","Great food and amazing service","
Excellent experience here
The waiter was from Italy and was extremely friendly. He had great suggestions for the menu. We started with the Burrata Pomodoro - italian mozzarella with tomatoes and arugala and then went with the Paccheri Golosi (pasta with porcini mushrooms, truffle oil in a tomato cream sauce) and a lobster pasta special. Both were unbelievable. I have...

More ",5.0,3.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row29"},{"data":["LukeS90","Easily one of the best italian restaurants in SF","
I've been various times in this place during my stay in San Francisco and it never disappointed me. If you want to eat a pasta that is almost the same as the one in Italy this is the right place to go. I suggest the delicious lobster pasta and crab pasta. The service is also good and there are actually...

More ",5.0,97.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row30"},{"data":["Andiamo88","Excellent food and fun atmosphere","
With all of the restaurants in San Francisco, I eat at least one meal here every time I come to SF. E Tutto Qua always has phenomenal food and a boisterous happy atmosphere. The consistently high quality of the food is amazing, and they make it look easy with all of the banter and laughter that is going on. The...

More ",5.0,20.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row31"},{"data":["debracake","You cannot help but to smile here","
The guys who work here have so much fun and are so cheerful, it makes me want to work here! Never mind I'm a senior lady...... I had the Ravioli di Castagne (filled with chestnuts in a buttery sage sauce but I didn't get the crispy pancetta on top, being vegetarian). For dessert I copied what I saw on my...

More ",5.0,70.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row32"},{"data":["Claudia C","Top","
This restaurant is amazing! You can enjoy the real Italian food. I had lunches and dinners in lots of expensive restaurants in San Francisco : this is the best place
",5.0,3.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row33"},{"data":["zanelottilj","Takes an Italian to know one..","
Freshest ingredients, not heavy, friendly bustling atmosphere. We had an antipasto made from procuitto and the softest mozzarella. The pasta was light and yummy, dessert wonderful. Highly recommend.
",5.0,6.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row34"},{"data":["TXAg1999","AMAZING","
This is as close to real Italian food as I've had since we were in Italy. All the waiters speak Italian and the food is amazing! Do yourself a favor and go!!
",5.0,5.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row35"},{"data":["SuTengKai","3 dishes, 3 times perfect","
Prior to dining my lovely wife and I had about 6 hours hiking about the Marine Highlands so we were hungry when we arrived.
Our first impression was Wow, this place is busy and secondly that the host was a lot of fun. We called from the road and had a 19:45 reservation but were seated about 20:00. The previous...

More ",5.0,247.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row36"},{"data":["dchapelier","Excellent place","
My girlfriend and I were looking for a good food experience in Little Italy.
We ended up @ E Tutto Qua and don't regret it at all
Service is perfect. Very professional and friendly at the same time.
Recommendations for both wine and food have been proven good ones (without being the most expensive options)
The food was amazing, and...

More ",5.0,2.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row37"},{"data":["picchiosandman","Perfetto","
Are you looking for a great Italian restaurant? This is it.
The service is great and attentive. The food is authentic Italian cooked by an expert in Italian cuisine. Price is average so very affordable ask for their signature dessert Panna Cotta. Mamma Mia to die for. This establishment delivers great results.
",5.0,20.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row38"},{"data":["BrunoPaes14","Great dishes in a confortable environment","
Great dishes in a confortable environment. We were greeted with joy and attention. Meals are typically Italian and delicious. Recommend.
",5.0,1.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row39"},{"data":["Baseball39","Loved it","
Very noisy, but great wait staff. Loved the food. Stuffed pork chop for me, seafood pasta for my wife. Nicely prepared. Great wine list. Highly recommend.
",5.0,41.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row40"},{"data":["ASpiegel","Great italian restaurant","
We got there hungry and without a reservation. Even though we were a party of 6 they fixed a table for us and dispatched our food promptly. Food was good and service excellent. Highly recommended.
",5.0,13.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row41"},{"data":["Andrea S","Thin and crispy","
Finally pizzas as they they were intended to be, fresh, crispy and thin.
Maybe not the best place for a romantic date, but a fantastic place to go anyway. Great value, too.
We stopped overnight in San Francisco from our trip back from Hawaii, and this place makes you forget that vacation is over.
",4.0,4.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row42"},{"data":["Lynn S","Disappointed!","
Very disappointed. Made reservations for 7:00. Not seated until 7:25. Instead of a leisurely, multi-course meal, we ordered something fast enough to leave for theatre by 8:00. Spinach fettuccine with scallops and shrimp was fast, but had only chips of seafood%%65533no whole shrimp or scallops. Noise level so high, we yelled across a table for 2. Even with reservations, a...

More ",2.0,2.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row43"},{"data":["ChicoRanMan","Our favorite North Beach restaurant","
Although it's a little noisey, okay VERY noisey, we love the food at this place. The very thin pizza is simple and tastey and the pasta dishes we've had have been the best I've ever eaten in San Francisco. So if you don't mind the restaurant staff shouting back & forth to one another, this is a very worthwhile place...

More ",5.0,25.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row44"},{"data":["susanjane_9","Great Experience","
Our thanksgiving dinner here while on vacation. service and atmosphere wonderful and fun. food was excellent..Linguine with scallops and crabmeat....delicioso! Profiteroles for dessert...decadent. Great company to enjoy it with. Hate to admit this but waiter ran out into street calling me by my first name to catch me and return the credit card I had forgotten! wasn't that amazing?
",5.0,48.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row45"},{"data":["slmcdaniel","Wonderful North Beach Italian","
Had a wonderful, authentic Italian meal here. The servers were fantastic - attentive, knowledgeable and funny. Best Italian I've had in North Beach in a long while - will go back for both the food and service. They did a great job. Also, great wine list and grappa selections!
",5.0,15.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row46"},{"data":["DenmarkDanes","WHAT !!!!!!!","
The noise in this place is incredible! If you are a large group and sit more than 1m apart it is practically impossible to have a meaningful conversation.
BUT the food is super, the waiters very attentative, fub and knowledgeable.
Some highlights were Pasta i Fagioli, the Pizza ai Porchini. The day' s specials that were tried but some of...

More ",4.0,118.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row47"},{"data":["tournesolchef","Columbus would not be pleased!","
Arrived here the Saturday night of Columbus Day weekend upon a recommendation of the Concierge at the Mark Hopkins - we were looking for North Beach authentic Italian. Perhaps Columbus Day weekend was the reason for incredible noise, slow service and snarky waiters, but if not, I still can not figure out the excuse. With a reservation and hotel call...

More ",2.0,4.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row48"},{"data":["OhGawd","Recommend","
Most of the points raised in other reviews are valid. Yes it's too noisy and yes the service slows a little as the night wares on...because the place is full!
I couldn't fault the food in fact it was better than that served at a lot more swish places. Also the waiters maintained their charm!
Recommended.
",3.0,2.0,"Luigia","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row49"},{"data":["TnJAdvents","Great sidewalk service","
Had a terrific evening out with friends the other night at the Pants Rei. We liked the look of the menu and decided to try it out! We shared and loved the crab cakes.
I enjoyed a delicious Caesar salad (yummy anchovies on top!) the only think that was not amazing was the browning of the lettuce pieces.. I was...

More ",4.0,118.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row50"},{"data":["Amanda M","Excellent Food, Excellent Service","
We went to Panta Rei with our friends and their three young children. I have to say that when I think of service with a smile, this is it! Our server was super friendly and accommodating. When we arrived, he took the kids' orders immediately and made suggestions for modifications to the menu items. He was incredibly attentive; he even...

More ",5.0,7.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row51"},{"data":["Matilda_26","Good Food Slow Service","
Had dinner here with a party of five work colleagues. We liked the outdoor seating and were seated right away. The wine and the food were delicious. Try the white pizza with zucchini or the swordfish. The desserts are amazing as well. My only complaint was that, while the staff was extremely nice, the service was pretty slow. We waited...

More ",4.0,70.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row52"},{"data":["GEFromNH","Solid North Beach Italian","
Multiple good dishes. Excellent calzone and margherita pizza. Pasta was very flavorful but a bit overcooked.
WAIT STAFF was outstanding and attentive.
",4.0,29.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row53"},{"data":["KJC531","Authentic & Delicious!","
We loved the food at Panta Rei! My partner had the fettucine with duck in a brandy cream sauce and I had the linguine with pancetta and peas in a cream sauce- both were delicious and the portions were large! We saw some desserts go to other tables and wished we had room for them as they looked great. Our...

More ",5.0,6.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row54"},{"data":["MRFaulk","Great Food and Atmosphere","
The food was amazing. It is a small restaurant and cozy. We ordered the lasagna and spaghetti. It was so good and the portions are generous. The atmosphere is nice as well. I would definitely go back.
",5.0,16.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row55"},{"data":["E M","Pretty yummy","
We've been here a lot, always go back for the tiramisu, which is really good. Came for lunch this time and I think everyone in our party liked the food. Mine was delicious... brunch, actually, so I got eggs/sausage and potatoes and it was delicious. My husband had a pasta dish that had lots of salmon in it. Overall good....

More ",4.0,28.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row56"},{"data":["DYA717","Great food and service","
In Little Italy, along the way to Fisherman's Wharf, A nice airy restaurant. I enjoyed dinner and drinks. Great food and service.
",4.0,214.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row57"},{"data":["Jenny G","touristy and average","
Friendly but bad service. Cute decor, sat in the window. Touristy part of town with no parking. We had the four course dinner. Wine was average table wine. Cesar salad and mushroom ravioli were tasty. Mains were a big disappointment. The tiramisu that everyone raves about was good but overrated. Wouldn't go back.
",3.0,82.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row58"},{"data":["Constance M","Tasteless","
I'm surprised at the positive reviews. The four of us ordered a ravioli dish, sea bass and a chicken pasta dish. Each entree was bland and tasteless. None of us were pleased with the food. The ambiance is just okay; the service was good. I'm not inclined to try it again.
",2.0,24.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row59"},{"data":["Topolli","Excellent Italian Restaurant","
Excellence in North Beach. Wonderful, professional yet friendly service. Great atmosphere. Food was delicious and chef will go out of his way to accommodate any special requests. Beginning with freshly baked focaccia bread along with balsamic vinegar and olive oil. The pasta of course is homemade and portions generous with reasonable prices. Highly recommended for lunch or dinner.
",5.0,126.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row60"},{"data":["Typh00n","Reasonable prices but a lot of carb","
Very busy restaurant, with very cramped seating. There was barely enough space on our tiny table to fit everything. They bring some very tasty bread round to start, and then I had chicken which was a little overcooked, served with a generous serving of homemade pasta. But there were no vegetables on the plate, and between the bread and the...

More ",3.0,26.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row61"},{"data":["Phil B","A North Beach Gem","
The modern decor and friendly wait staff are the first clue a treat is waiting. A diverse and interesting Italian food menu grabs your attention. The hot focaccia with olive oil & balsamic tides the hunger while the salads and main courses are prepared. People watching soon takes over as neighborhood friends liven the place. What a taste treat when...

More ",5.0,34.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row62"},{"data":["MillieWT","Italian home style cooking!","
Can't go wrong with this place! Their menu was so easy to pick from. The choices were just right! I've been searching for black pasta - They have it! Yum - for those who are curious- squid ink pasta - pasta nere with clams, mussels and shrimps! Can't say enough! Group of four and we cleaned our plates- go for...

More ",4.0,140.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row63"},{"data":["ronadebra","nice no beach restaurant","
Made reservations here since it was around the corner fr Bch Blanket Babylon show.
We have been here on previous SF trip
Waiter was very pleasant
We shared an appy of clams/mussles in wine sauce-very tasty
DH had lasagna- homemade and I had salmon. Both dishes were very good
would return if in area again
",4.0,171.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row64"},{"data":["ondbrink","North Beach Treasure","
Italian provincial dining in a friendly atmosphere with a street view. We really enjoyed eating here. There are plenty of choices on the menu and wine list. It just feels good to be here
",4.0,39.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row65"},{"data":["Marconap","Authentic Italian in San Francisco","
I found this restaurant through restaurant.com and it was a pleasant surprise. I usually avoid italian restaurant, but this one was very true to the italian food. I suggest the abbacchio (lamb) which was cooked just fine.
",4.0,68.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row66"},{"data":["Sister67_13","Delicious Italian in North Beach","
The concierge recommended this since it was a quick walk from our hotel. So authentic - they all spoke Italian! Food was delicious, service was quick and very enthusiastic, great little restaurant!
",5.0,18.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row67"},{"data":["WaltripWoman","Really Great Meal at a Reasonable City Price","
Great dinner with a variety of choices. Sauces were not too heavy, and plenty of meals ranging from pasta to duck, fish, veal, lamb and beef. Tiramisu is excellent as was the chocolate souffle.
",5.0,38.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row68"},{"data":["zik_10","Great place good food","
We stopped to have dinner with our kids the place Was full and busy and still the service was great, nice and very kids friendly the food was good and the atmosphere was great!
",5.0,15.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row69"},{"data":["Nori81","Good food, but atmosphere keeps this from being a great choice","
We were visiting family in San Francisco for the weekend and felt fortunate to be able to get a reservation at the last minute on Open Table. The area was full of Italian restaurant options, and parking was very difficult to find. We were quickly seated, and the menu had plenty of authentic Italian pasta dishes and enough variety for...

More ",3.0,15.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row70"},{"data":["Agnieszka73","Great service and food","
We stopped there just to have a coffee but the menu looked so delicious that we decided to stay longer;))) And it was a right decision. Great atmosphere and delicious food: pizza, ravioli, salmon with asparsgus:) Worth visiting to feel like in Italy:)
",5.0,1.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row71"},{"data":["croatianwife","Great Food and Great Location for People Watching","
This was a return visit based on an excellent experience last time I was in San Francisco. It helps that the handsome waitstaff all have sexy Italian accents. (My sister and I joked that perhaps they were locals that had to learn the accent to contribute to the atmosphere.) This is located on a corner and great spot for people...

More ",5.0,44.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row72"},{"data":["SweetSunshine7","Good, Not Great Italian Food","
There are so many options for Italian food in North Beach, which can overwhelm a hungry traveler. We decided on Panta Rei since the food was reasonably priced and could find dishes we'd eat. My boyfriend had this pasta and shellfish dish and I had the spinach ravioli. To me, the spinach tasted like it had been frozen instead of...

More ",3.0,19.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row73"},{"data":["magnamosa","this is the real deal... just like eating in Sicily","
this is a nice little spot in north beach that is just the right size and place for a great Italian experience. we got a window seat to enjoy some people watching during dinner and had a delightful time. started with the clams/mussels and i'll warn you to get plenty of bread as you'll want to sop up every ounce...

More ",4.0,71.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row74"},{"data":["mrjrm","Great Pasta, Good drinks and nice atmosphere","
Well I am a local in San Francisco now and have been for years, Panta Rei has since remodeled itself and changed from how it used to be. But the food has remained very good and I had dinner their just this past Tuesday, June 11, 2013, they have good food and also some good drinks to choose from.
I...

More ",4.0,1.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row75"},{"data":["Robert R","Curb side restraunt/cafe with good food","
Great place to eat prior to Beach Blanket Babylon. Just a short one half block away.
Service is not nothing to talk about since only one waiter who was tired and stressed out waited on us. Very nice atmosphere and great wine list.
",3.0,14.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row76"},{"data":["Lisaanddarren2213","Great Pasta!","
We visited here after a day wine tasting in the Napa Valley.
Service was great, prompt and friendly. We were given sour dough with olive oil and balsamic to nibble on while we waited for our mains.
The mushroom tortellini was fabulous, flavor some and filled with juicy mushrooms, the creamy asparagus sauce was tasty and the asparagus spears were...

More ",4.0,6.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row77"},{"data":["Hawaii-Biker","Great Find in North Beach","
We chose this restaurant mainly because it was close to an engagement we had later in the evening. When we walked in at 5:30, we knew that we were dining very early, but we worried a bit about our being the only ones there. The atmosphere was unusual with metal tables, but there was a fresh flower on each one....

More ",4.0,105.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row78"},{"data":["skytre","Another nice authentic Italian option in North Beach","
We ate at 4 different Italian places in North Beach and they all started to blur together a bit by the end of the week. We recall Panta Rei as having good, fresh pasta at surprisingly lower prices compared to the waterfront areas. The servers were Italian and that lent to the authentic feel. The side-walk tables had heaters (which...

More ",4.0,173.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row79"},{"data":["Mel W","Wonderful food, great service","
I am so grateful to have ended up at this restaurant! I was visiting SF for a couple of days with my husband and daughter and we were looking for a place to eat in North Beach - it was hard to decide with so many to choose from! As other reviewers say there are plenty of tourist traps! We...

More ",5.0,6.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row80"},{"data":["Aussie_gasman","The best waiter ever... Food's pretty good too.","
So we went looking for a place to eat in Little Italy on St Patrick's Day, no reservation, big party, people everywhere. Great idea hey? We walk past once, they seemed pretty full so we went elsewhere, but came back again back the other way and they some how found us a table by the window. A very tiny restaurant...

More ",4.0,3.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row81"},{"data":["Rena0109","Authentic Italian","
Went to this restaurant last night. North Beach is being squeezed out by Chinatown and there are not a lot of great Italian restaurants left. This place is right on Columbus and it's lively and fun. The wait staff is Italian and the pasta is made fresh daily. The menu isn't huge but there is enough to choose from so...

More ",4.0,28.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row82"},{"data":["TomR4012","Fun Italian Bar and Dining","
Wonderful for sitting by the window and watching the people pass by. Good wine selection and very decent food.
",5.0,33.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row83"},{"data":["sbc789","Excellent homemade pasta!","
Nice Italian dinner in a nice setting for a moderate price. Homemade pasta and ravioli were excellent, particularly the squid ink linguini nere. House wines by the glass were so-so. Nice waiter.
",4.0,31.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row84"},{"data":["Rodrigo C","Authentic Pizza Napolitana","
If you are looking for a real Napoli style pizza, this is the place to go. Service is good and fast. Good wine selection. Very good place overall.
",4.0,14.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row85"},{"data":["JO14_10","good food and lovely staff","
four of us went to thia restaurant and we had a great time,the staff were friendly and helpful when it came to choosing the food and wine. Will definatley go back again when we are there.
",4.0,72.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row86"},{"data":["ONYX808","Best Gnocchi in the USA!!!","
My favorite food is gnocchi and Im very picky about it, eveytime I see gnocchi in the menu thats what I will order no questions ask, Normally I end up not 100% happy with the dish but Panta Rei takes the award to the best Gnocchi in the USA that I have tried in my 12 years of living here....

More ",5.0,7.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row87"},{"data":["sempreingiro1979","Good italian food","
Recommended is the lamb and fettuccine panta rei
The italian maitre, Lorenzo, is a very kind guy
Good selection if wines and beers.
",4.0,16.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row88"},{"data":["Mano B","If you love Italy you love Panta Rei","
After a digusting Day in San Francisco, an awesome dinner!
If you are from europe and you got rid of all the amerikan Pizza style, visit this place.
Wether if you like Italian wine or authentic food you have to try this location.
Just sit there and enjoy. Great wine, grappa and... best Italian coffee.
AAA+ Love it.
",5.0,7.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row89"},{"data":["Johnny_Hellzapoppin","Excellent Italian","
North Beach is packed with authentic Italian restaurants so I don't really know how we picked this one, but so glad we did. The food - squid ink seafood pasta and salmon pasta - was delicious. The service was superb - friendly, fun and attentive. A complimentary shot of Lemoncello was a nice touch at the end!
",5.0,13.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row90"},{"data":["CarolWichita_Kansas","North Beach Restaurant","
Just happened upon this restaurant in North Beach. We stopped for an early dinner, and we were the only customers. Waiters were very attentive. They recommended the sangria, which was one of the drink specials of the day. Very refreshing, altho quite different from other sangrias I have had. Had appetizer of focaccia with tomato and mozzarella. I had chicken...

More ",4.0,9.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row91"},{"data":["FresYesHuh","Great authentic Italian","

The restaurant was packed, but he said that he could clear a table for the 4 of us in just a minute, so we gave it a shot. It was great! All of the workers were Italian and...

More ",4.0,26.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row92"},{"data":["IllinoisCookie","An Excellant Find","
Wow, we were so happy to find this restaurant. It is in the North Beach district. The food was amazing, We had their lasagna and it was fantastic. The service was great and its worth your money to go here.
",5.0,111.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row93"},{"data":["CosmicFlyer","Out of this world","
A week later, my mouth still starts to water when I am telling friends about this place. My husband even favorably compared this place to his Italian grandmother's cooking, and you'll have to believe me, that NEVER happens. Panta Rei re-opened my eyes to the beauty of authentic Italian cuisine. My gnocchi melted in my mouth, as it filled every...

More ",5.0,24.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row94"},{"data":["dljhk","Excellent food, but very noisy","
The food was excellent and service was great, but we couldn't hear ourselves talk and that was in what they said was the quieter room. The tagolini with scallops and sea bass pomedoro were excellent, very tasty. However, two large groups in the room made the noise level so loud we didn't stay for dessert because we wanted to be...

More ",4.0,55.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row95"},{"data":["azcat-gv","Delightful Dinner","
This an honest-to-goodness review about Panta Rei restaurant. We arrived an hour early before our reservation and they were able to seat us. For our antipasti, we selected the Arancio & finocchio (a...

More ",5.0,3.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row96"},{"data":["nguerinoni","A tasty slice of Italy with lots of pastas","

The menu has a good selection of pastas, that have a different slant to anywhere else I've seen. I had the mushroom ravioli with asparagus sauce, which I'm...

More ",5.0,10.0,"Ghiotto","Italian"],"rowKey":"Row97"},{"data":["gardgal","Lamb shank to die for!","

It isn't quite in Chinatown and it isn't quite in the Financial District (although it seems to lean more towards the Financial District), AND the decor isn't Chinatown either. You could miss it. More ","
The food at E Tutto Qua was really, really good. My friend and I dined here for the 2-week special Dine About Town prix fixed $36.95 dinner featuring 3 courses. Unlike some other places, the portions here were full sized. The place seemed to have more a local feel with many younger adults than one that is where tourists typically...

More ","
This is by far the cleanest and nicest dim sum restaurant I have been to. It's quite fancy actually compared to the old and traditional Chinese restaurants in china town but they do serve great dim sum here and they provide you with the real dim sum fast service too. Yes their price is a bit more than the usual...

More ","
Amazing food, great family atmosphere, amazing food lol. Would return while in san fran in a second. A must see
","

More ","[...]","

","
Sincerely...what a delight to walk into this restaurant! We have four children - three of whom cannot eat gluten, including myself. The staff could not have been more helpful, they went through all of our options, that included not having to take something from the kids menu. Its so refreshing to be in a restaurant, that are so helpful when...

More ","
Definitely the best Italian spot in San Francisco without question. The secret is out!! To be brief the lasagna is to die for, and the pizza is tremendous! The recipes were done to beyond perfection! The...

More ","
Okay, so it's really pizza and pasta, and wine of course, at Baonecci. We tried a variety of appetizers and I especially liked the bresaola while my wife liked the coppa, which is in the mixed tray of meats.
The wife judges Italian by the taste and quality of the arrabiatta and Baonecci's pasta passed the test.
We tried a...

More ","
Tiny hole in the wall italian family restaurant that has great neapolitian style pizza. They have other menu offerings but I recommend you get the pizza and a carafe of the house wine. Loved it and want to go back.
